title: Countering America's Adversaries Through Sanctions Act
added: The Act imposed new sanctions on Russia for interference in the 2016 US elections and its involvement in Ukraine and Syria. The Act converted the punitive measures previously imposed by Executive Orders into law to prevent the easing, suspending or ending of sanctions by the President without the approval of the United States Congress.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lardner|first1=Richard|title=Senate GOP, Dems agree on new sanctions on Russia|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/senate-gop-dems-agree-sanctions-russia-47997685|access-date=14 June 2017|work=ABC News|date=12 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170613053011/https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/senate-gop-dems-agree-sanctions-russia-47997685|archive-date=13 June 2017|url-status=dead}}

</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Flegenheimer|first1=Matt|title=New Bipartisan Sanctions Would Punish Russia for Election Meddling|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/13/us/politics/senate-sanctions-russia.html|access-date=14 June 2017|work=The New York Times|date=13 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170614104442/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/13/us/politics/senate-sanctions-russia.html|archive-date=14 June 2017|url-status=live}}</ref>
